Default Environment

DefaultCalculator registers the default calculators. See the plugins by category

  • Plugins - Additions

  • Plugins - Functionality

  • Plugins - Meta

  • Plugins - Notation

  • Plugins - Output

  • Plugins - Reminders

class symcalc.DefaultCalculator(*args, **kwargs)

A Calculator that contains the default environment. Running the module is equivalent to

>>> import symcalc
>>> symcalc.DefaultCalculator().register_default_plugins().interact("Demo")
Demo >>>

Examples

Calculator >>> solve(x**2+4x-7)
New symbol: x
[-2 + √11, -√11 - 2]
Decimals: [1.3166, -5.3166]
Result stored in out[1]

Calculator >>> solveset(sin(x))
{2⋅n⋅π │ n ∊ ℤ} ∪ {2⋅n⋅π + π │ n ∊ ℤ}
Result stored in out[2]

Calculator >>> diff(2x**2sin(x))
2
2⋅x ⋅cos(x) + 4⋅x⋅sin(x)
Result stored in out[3]

Calculator >>> _.subs(x, 3)
18⋅cos(3) + 12⋅sin(3)
Decimal: -16.1264248420896
Result stored in out[4]

Calculator >>> integrate(sin(x)**2, (x,0,2))
  sin(2)⋅cos(2)
- ───────────── + 1
        2
Decimal: 1.18920062382698
Result stored in out[5]

Calculator >>> v[1,2,3]+v[4,5,6]
⎡5⎤
⎢ ⎥
⎢7⎥
⎢ ⎥
⎣9⎦
Result stored in out[6]

Calculator >>> m[1,2,3\3,2,1\5,5,9]
⎡1  2  3⎤
⎢       ⎥
⎢3  2  1⎥
⎢       ⎥
⎣5  5  9⎦
Result stored in out[7]

Calculator >>> _.det()
-16
Result stored in out[8]

Calculator >>> out[7]*out[6]
⎡46 ⎤
⎢   ⎥
⎢38 ⎥
⎢   ⎥
⎣141⎦
Result stored in out[9]

Initializes the calculator. See Calculator

Note

This does NOT automatically register the default plugins. Call register_default_plugins()

register_default_plugins()

Registers the default plugins.

Returns

Returns self for chaining

Return type

DefaultCalculator

interact(*args, **kwargs)

See Calculator.interact()
